title: @Riot; If the Evelynn rework that is being threatened goes through, will she conserve theme/voice?
body:
http://img00.deviantart.net/d441/i/2016/116/8/9/evelynn_by_midorinemurase-da0b6e6.jpg

Title.

Also I am a multi-season Diamond that has thousands of Evelynn matches under my proverbial belt, I want to know if Eve-chan will be Taric'd

replies.body: It's impossible to say how much a champion will or won't change before we actually begin to work on them. Once we assign a core team for a champion rework we begin what we call "open ideation." During this phase of development we break down what we absolutely think is core to a character. We then take that core and rebuild the Champion with that core intact. The level of change a champion goes through depends on how much we feel is core and can't be changed, which varies from champion to champion.
Reav3, what happens if the core that's left over of things riot is willing to keep doesn't match at all with what her fans love about her?

I think we have a pretty good track record on or big VGU's for keeping whats important (Sion/Taric/GP/Trist/Poppy/Ryze)

Shen was not a big VGU and I think that was a mistake, he honestly should have been. 

All I can really say is that we really do care about the champions we work on, and we have a lot of heated discussions about what is and isn't core to a champion when we are working on them. 

We also bring in mains of the champion multiple times during the development of a VGU and pivot/change direction if needed based on there feedback.

Karma begs to differ.

Mind, you are improving. I won't argue with you on any of the champs you listed barring maybe GP. But I'm still salty over the Karma rework.

The process for creating a VGU has changed dramatically since the Trundle and Karma VGU's. Sion was the first VGU were we developed the current process we are using for our VGUs (Which is the process of breaking a character down to its "Core pilalrs" and then re-building from there)
Karma re-relaunch when?

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=EV5z967P,comment-id=00030000000000020000,timestamp=2016-08-05T20:37:25.708+0000)

Would Karma be up for a kit rework, considering that she was the pioneer guinea pig and ended up being not too successful?

Not to be crude or rude, but a simple "We fucked up" would have sufficed. I would rather you talk about why the team isn't putting in effort to rectify the mistake they made towards Karma.

I find it a bit odd that the VGU theme would consider whats core to a champion after a few failed reworks/update/launch. The fact that players have always been concerned about whether an old element of a beloved champion would be retained after a huge change has always been present. It feels very unsettling to hear that during the first few conceptualization that no one in the VGU  team had made a conscious effort to retain what is core and unique about the champion. It shows how slow you guys are in catching up and learning from your mistakes. 

What more, every time someone asks when a splash art/visual update is happening, someone in the team can tell people Karma is in the list, but no balls to mention when exactly within the list she is slated for a splash art update. 

When it comes to Karma, all departments across Riot is strangely inefficient... There is simply no transparency involved in Karma's case and it looks horrible.

Eh I strictly disagree that you kept the core personality of Poppy intact. How you took the only stoic yordle and made her that naive thing I do not know.

And while it's not an update, somehow the writers turned a soldier into a body hopping space alien.

The GP rework was pretty heartbreaking, since it flipped the script on basically everything about him.
Young(er) swashbuckler >>> Salty old captain
Values the open seas     >>> Values power/ his place in bilgewater
Joker, relished piracy      >>>  Cynical  and grim 

I mean from reading things Riot has put out, what Riot identifies as important are usually pretty superficial  like the oranges meme or if GP wore a hat(???) .

I don't know, I just wish Riot would stop holding up GP as a successful _Update_ , because it wasn't. They had a successful launch of a new character.

Hey ShinyJumanjiMan,

Sorry you didn't enjoy the GP rework. Unfortunately, I don't think we will ever make every player happy with our updates. The reason we hold it in high regard is because of the data we get from our players. After a big rework and also periodically on all our champions, we survey our players on thoughts on the champions. We survey mains and non-mains and can filter data from both. GP was actually very positively received by both mains and non-mains on his launch and even close to a year later in our recent mass champion survey he was rated in the top 20 favorite champions by players. 

Obviously if you didn't like his update this isn't going to convince you to like him, just wanted to answer your question about why we regard his update highly.

Seeing as Gangplank is my most played champ, I thought I should say, I love the new Gangplank. He was ok before the rework, but he quickly became my favorite champion after it. I love his VO, lore, gameplay, everything. I think the Captain skin retains most of the things that made him feel like a pirate.

There was a lot of negativity in this thread. Just wanted to add something positive. I love the VGU's. There is a lot of ways you guys can mess up. But somehow you don't and do a great job.
Where do these surveys take place? I never get to do them. Granted, I haven't played in like a year.

To me GP was a successful update. Sorry if you liked the older VO and stuff... but it was totally unrelated to who GP was. There was a lot of disconnection and that made him really incoherent and being just a "joke champion".

At least they made a skin that was sent for free that depicted him more as a jolly pirate, his Captain one.

Also this is only lorewise - mechanically wise was almost perfect, even thought a bit strong.

> We also bring in mains of the champion multiple times during the development of a VGU and pivot/change direction if needed based on there feedback.

I hope that is actually true.

I would hate to see Evelynn go the way of Mordekaiser or Skarner.

Morde and Skarner were not full VGU's and had a much shorter development time. That was back when we were trying to do roster projects in like 3-4 months. WE have since increased the time for roster projects to 6 months so we can get much more playtests and community feedback in on our changes.

The bug VGU's are usually in development for 9-12 months and have no art, narrative or design constraints and have MANY playtests internally and with players.

Related question;Will Evelynn keep her voice actress or get a new one like Sion?

Not sure. We usually bring in the old VO actor to audition when we do our big VGUs. We will choose the best actor based on the auditions. If the old VO actor is the right choice then we would of course keep her.

Yes I think most of the bigger ones have been right.  I kind of disagree with poppy's rework though in several fronts, personally I view that one as a failure.  

However Evelynn has her own issues, which I listed above...  part of her theme seems to be that who she is kind of left up to the player.  Based from everything I've gathered from riot, that alone is something that's going.  Riot seems to be pushing for extremely clear identities right now and specialized champs.  That's not Evelynn.

 I'm not even sure if she'd be made at all today because she seems like she doesn't adhere to any of current riot's design philosophies visually or mechanically.  I mean I could see today's riot doing a sion or a taric or any of those other champs you listed if they weren't in the game, but I don't see the riot of today doing a recognizable version of Evelynn and that kind of worries me when it comes time to for you guys to do a rework for her.   I mean if there was no evelynn, I just don't see riot releasing a champ that looks like her or plays like her.
So would you say there is little to no value in fixing mistakes like Shen, and unfinished reworks like Karma; who also saw her theme trashed with her rework?

What about Quinn? I think a lot of us can agree that her core gameplay thematic was being the tag team/duo Champion who could switch places with Valor to alter her playstyle from "kitey Marksman" to "speedy melee Assassin," yet with her update this was the first thing to go out the window and I haven't really seen any Rioters step up to say whether this was a step in the wrong direction for the character as they've done with Shen.

As an aside, I think Quinn and Valor's core character may have been more apparent from the get-go if their nametag had been kept as "Quinn and Valor" all along, but unfortunately it was shortened to just "Quinn" right before they were released which I feel may have hurt the Champion in the long run. I think the former does a better job at conveying the fact they are supposed to be a duo working in tandem -- Valor shouldn't be accessorizing Quinn; rather, they should have equal presence and importance on the battlefield, which the Marksman update did not preserve in spite of how important that was to the character.
Sorry I was speaking about or large VGU's not our roster projects

Agree about Shen. If his ultimate looked like in his splash art rather then the old recall painted purple it would be so cool. That and if he had a recall.

The model is great though!
What do you want to change on Shen? His appearance? Lore? His kit still?
So, what about Eve _is_ considered important? The only unique traits she has are her invisibility and her BDSM outfit.

If I may ask, with the Ryze update now live, did the Ryze VGU team move on to get the {{champion:19}} update into the production stage?  If I recall correctly, the 2 VGU teams move on to another champ once they finished working with one. The Poppy team went on to work on Yorick, which is still in progress & the Taric team went on to work on Ryze, which is done now.
Yup. The Ryze team have already begun work on WW.

I feel like a lot of people simply play Eve wrong. She's currently one of my best champions (61% winrate ~ in 31 games climbing slowly from Plat to Dia). Many people call her underpowered - that's because she isn't an AP champ anymore. AD/Trinity Eve has a much better jungle clear and has far more consistent.

Please don't change a great champion just because people are stuck with a wrong mindset of her.

She's possibly the healthiest assassin ingame:
She's a permanent threat but can dash/jump on you like other assassins, you can run from her and kite her. Her damage ist great when duelling, but relatively weak when chasing or kiting which opens up a lot of counterplay.

Heh, I hardly would argue the fact that she can maintain invisibility when she is roaming the map dangerous.

As Dominick stated, her stealth is primarily a Green Ward bypass, and not much else. It helps her perform ganks through riskier routes, though it doesn't change the fact that she has no gap closer and cannot attack from stealth. She honestly has the tamest (healthiest) version of stealth in the current game. If people have good map awareness and play with the knowledge that there is an Evelynn somewhere on the map, her passive wouldn't even be classified as a nuisance.
If by "Taric'd" you mean her voice and model are changed to not sound/look like shit then yes I hope she is.

By "Taric'd" I think they refer to the changed voice specifically. Meaning, at least in my opinion, Taric just sounds like some guy they pulled in off the street. Before his rework, his voice was deep, earthy yet smooth. It seemed to fit him as the Gem Knight far more than the "Some Guy" they have now.

Same applies to Nasus, really. The current iteration of Susan sounds like Lucian being bored. Older Nasus sounded powerful and thoughtful at the same time.

First of all new Taric's old voice sounds like it's from a man 20 years older than the new character model so keeping the old voice would be weird.  And he sounds like some guy off the street? His new voice actor is actually pretty famous. As for Nasus, his new voice actor is so much better.  I would say the exact opposite of what you said applies to Nasus's voice.

I wouldn't know about a "Famous Voice Actor". He may very well be. I'm just saying that the current Taric sounds like any normal guy off the street, which is not something I affiliate with most Champions. 

As for Nasus' voice, I wouldn't really say it's better so much as an entirely different performance.

When I listen to older Nasus, I can hear a specific part of him that fits the story and thematic around him. Thoughtful, cautious, Ex-Librarian. When Old Nasus speaks, he speaks every line as if lost in thought, always thinking, almost mournful.

New Nasus, I see as a warrior, an ascended who will fight for his kingdom.

Old Nasus, I see as the Scholar as described in the Lore.
New Nasus, I see the Soldier described in the Lore.

It is merely my personal preference that I prefer the Scholar to the Soldier.
